abstractContent.text: I will look back through nearly forty years of computational research on discourse, noting some problems (such as context-dependence and inference) that were identified early on as a hindrance to further progress, some admirable successes that we have achieved so far in the development of algorithms and resources, and some challenges that we may want to (or that we may have to!) take up in the future, with particular attention to problems of data annotation and genre dependence.
